item.description:
Greater Worcester Humanists is looking to expand it's community and world outreach. One way we hope to do this is volunteering our time. Join us to celebrate Earth Day 2009 at Broad Meadow Brook where we help spruce up trails and gardens, put on a fresh coat of paint, and dive into other spring cleaning projects. There are plenty of activities for all ages and abilities, like planting native wildflowers or more strenuous activities, such as clearing and hauling brush. There will be three projects that we will be able to help with. See details below. If you would like to join in, please indicate what project you would like to be in when you RSVP for this meetup and we will do our best to accommodate...

____________________________________________
Work for Wildlife
3rd Annual Statewide Volunteer Day

Broad Meadow Brook, Worcester

Butterfly and Fern Garden

Help us renew and prepare our Visitor Center Gardens for spring. We'll be weeding, raking, pruning, and transplanting to give our popular garden a head start for the season.

Free Educational Program: Learn about butterfly life cycles, and learn which plants are best for butterfly nectar and caterpillar food for our area.

Notes, Gear and Attire: This is an outdoor program with minimal walking; suitable for all ages. Wear long pants and sleeves, sun hat, sunscreen; and bring work gloves, trowel, and pruners if you have them.

Wildlife Habitat Management

Help us maintain the sapling woods, a habitat with young trees. We'll be cutting, pruning, and moving brush to clear areas allowing re-growth.

Free Educational Program: Learn about old field plant succession, and about the plants and animals that live in the earliest stages of forest growth.

Notes, Gear and Attire: This is a strenuous outdoor program, suitable for teenagers and adults, and requiring approximately one half mile of walking. Wear long pants and sleeves; bring a day pack with water and a snack; also bring work gloves, bow saws, and loppers if you have them.

Water Garden Construction

Help us install an accessible water garden near our visitor center. We'll be digging, moving gravel, building a stone retaining wall, and installing a small pond liner.

Free Educational Program: Learn how to build water gardens, and learn about how they benefit wildlife.
Notes, Gear and Attire: This is an outdoor program with lots of lifting, suitable for adults. Wear long pants and sleeves, work boots, and heavy work gloves.
item.name: Volunteer with GWH to Celebrate Earth Day 2009!
